FuncDef:
The nat64 alarm port-number threshold command sets an alarm threshold for the port usage in a NAT64 address pool or the user-based port usage.
The undo nat64 alarm port-number threshold command restores the default alarm thresholds for the port usage in a NAT64 address pool or the user-based port usage.
The default port usage in a NAT64 address pool and user-based port usage is 80%.
CLIs: undo nat64 alarm address-group port-number threshold [ <value> ]
undo nat64 alarm user port-number threshold [ <value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the alarm threshold of the usage of the NO-PAT address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80%.

Indicates the alarm threshold for the user-based port usage.
-

Indicates the alarm threshold for the port usage in a NAT64 address pool.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor NAT64 port usage, run the nat64 alarm port-number threshold command to set an alarm threshold for the port usage in a NAT64 address pool or the user-based port usage. If the port usage in a NAT64 address pool or the user-based port usage exceeds the alarm threshold, the system generates an alarm and records a log. After the port usage decreases to 87.5% or lower, the alarm is cleared.
Precautions
The number of user-specific pre-allocated ports is equal to the number of ports configured in the port-range command run in the NAT64 instance view. Usage of user-specific ports is equal to the number of user-specific ports in use divided by the number of user-specific pre-allocated ports. The nat alarm user port-number threshold command takes effect only after the port-range command is run in the NAT64 instance view. If usage of user-specific ports in use is greater than the alarm threshold threshold-value (80% by default) for usage-specific port usage, an alarm indicating that usage of user-specific ports in use exceeds the threshold is generated.
